thread.title: Hot Growth Stocks That Might Lead The Next Rally

title: Hot Growth Stocks That Might Lead The Next Rally
text:
Retail Sales Enjoy Solid Gain 
2 July sales rose 0.6% vs. the prior month, just beating views. With an upward revision to June, the data suggest Americans are now spending their cheap gas windfall. Autos and Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Prime Day led broad gains. But department-store sales fell. Kohl's (NYSE:KSS) dived 8.8% on weak Q2 ... 06:57 PM ET HBO To Stream 'Sesame St.' 
4 Time Warner's (NYSE:TWX) HBO acquired exclusive pay-cable and streaming rights to the next 5 seasons of "Sesame Street," plus rights to reruns. Sesame Workshop will also produce a spinoff and new original series for HBO. Terms were not disclosed. The deal comes as traditional media try to fend ... 06:57 PM ET HBO Moves To 'Sesame Street,' Evicts Netflix, Amazon 
Elmo, meet the Mother of Dragons. Time Warner's (NYSE:TWX) HBO is bringing Elmo and Cookie Monster to Khaleesi's territory with a five-year deal to air and stream new episodes of beloved kids' program "Sesame Street," as the "Game of Thrones" network sets its sights not on the fictional turf of ... 06:43 PM ET F5 Looks To 'Tuck In' More Security With ADC Hardware 
F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV), a maker of application delivery controllers (ADCs), has continued its winning ways under new CEO Manuel Rivelo, boosting revenue and profit by capitalizing on high demand for new software and security services to guard against digital data breaches. The Seattle-based ... 05:28 PM ET More-Confident Consumers Send Retail Sales Leaping 
Consumers spent briskly in July, a sign that they may be finally gaining confidence in the strengthening job market and the windfall from cheaper gas. Sales were up 0.6%, the Commerce Department said, topping economists' forecasts for an 0.5% rise. With autos stripped out, sales were up 0.4%, the ... 04:51 PM ET Amid Volatility, Some Stock Leaders Won't Bend 
It's been a rough week for some leading stocks, with many losing key support levels, such as the 50-day moving average on a daily chart (or the 10-week line on a weekly chart). Other leading growth stocks are holding up well. Those should be the ones savvy traders should keep their eyes on. Some of ... 08/12/2015 05:41 PM ET Hawaiian Airlines Flirts With Breakout 
The airline industry group was flying high Tuesday, and no wonder. Oil prices are still dropping, and the prospect of lower fuel prices had investors smiling. Airlines are the No. 13-ranked group out of 197 tracked by IBD â€” up from No. 118 just six weeks ago. Hawaiian Holdings (NASDAQ:HA), ... 08/11/2015 06:11 PM ET Paycom Nears Buy Point; Fundamentals Stand Out 
Paycom Software inched closer to a 39.27 buy point from a double-bottom base Monday as the stock participated in the general market rally. As often happens as bases are built, it looked as recently as two weeks ago as though investors should give the stock up for dead. It was trading below its ... 08/10/2015 05:37 PM ET 5 Top Stocks Retreat Into Buy Range. Should You Buy? 
Five leading stocks have pulled back near their buy points amid the recent market turbulence. Valeant Pharmaceuticals (NYSE:VRX) is among several that broke out in heavy volume following strong earnings reports. But it's retreated near a 246.11 buy point of a shallow cup base, erasing most of a 7% ... 08/07/2015 05:29 PM ET Top Growth Stock Apogee Shows Pick Up In Profit Gains 
Leading building products stock Apogee Enterprises (NASDAQ:APOG) is working on a possible new base amid accelerating earnings growth. The maker of glass walls and windows for commercial buildings has been bumping up against resistance at its 50-day moving average. The stock will need to climb above ... 08/06/2015 05:58 PM ET
